name: Cassian Virek di Khayradi
text_appearance: Cassian stands tall, lean, and meticulously groomed, his posture always reflecting military precision. He has short, neatly trimmed silver hair, and piercing lime-green eyes set above sharp, aristocratic features. He favours austere white-and-gold uniforms subtly adorned with the crest of House Virek.
history:
Cassian Virek di Khayradi was born into an ancient lineage of proud Khayradi nobility. For centuries, House Virek has served the House of Stone faithfully, renowned for their fierce commitment to duty, discipline, and tradition. Yet their prestige has long been shadowed by a humiliation suffered generations ago during the infamous Sanjak Revolution.

During that historic conflict nearly four hundred years ago, Cassian’s ancestor, Admiral Lucian Virek, was tasked with crushing the rebellion on the moon Sanjak. Though initially successful, Lucian was blindsided when insurgents revealed advanced military technologies supplied clandestinely by sympathetic Republican scientists from the House of Water on Umara. Lucian’s fleet was shattered, marking a devastating defeat for House Virek. The event resulted in disgrace, stripping House Virek of much of its former prestige—humiliation that has lingered unresolved through generations.

This ancestral shame has shaped Cassian’s upbringing profoundly. Since childhood, he has been taught that restoring the honor of House Virek is his life’s purpose. His father, Lord Regent Aldric Virek, ensured that Cassian grew up fully aware of their family’s damaged reputation, filling him with stories of past glories and the treachery of Umara’s Republican scientists. Cassian’s older sister, Alessa, was raised similarly, but tragically died young in an unrelated training accident—a loss that only increased the pressure on Cassian to become the family’s redeemer.

Over the generations, House Virek has quietly but persistently attempted to rebuild its standing, serving loyally in key military roles, and taking every opportunity to oppose the Republicans at every turn. But the shadow of their humiliation during the Sanjak Revolution continues to hang heavy—especially because the descendants of the Umara scientists responsible for Admiral Lucian’s defeat still flourish, celebrated openly as heroes and intellectual leaders among Republicans.

When Cassian learned that a direct descendant of that same House of Water scientist had risen to fame in Umara for revolutionary military innovations—earning praise among the Baronies' reformists—he felt the weight of centuries upon his shoulders. Determined to finally confront this ancient humiliation and restore the honor lost generations ago, Cassian committed himself fully to becoming an elite pilot worthy of his lineage’s ambitions.

Leveraging House Virek’s still-considerable political connections, Cassian secured entry into the prestigious Karrakin Cavalry College, pledging himself to master the deadly and efficient IPS-N Caliban chassis. Before leaving, his father handed Cassian a blade passed down from Admiral Lucian himself—an heirloom symbolizing their long-delayed quest for redemption. Cassian swore a solemn vow upon that blade that he would finally erase the family’s disgrace.

What Cassian could not yet know was that the very descendant of his family's nemesis, the renowned Umaran scientist now famed for their revolutionary designs, would also be attending the Cavalry College—setting the stage for an explosive clash of honour, ideals, and family legacies that has simmered for centuries.

systems.flavorDescription: By installing additional armor plating, redundant firing circuits, and enhanced insulation to magazines the longevity of a frame’s armaments can be greatly enhanced.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

The Hammer Universal Rotary Projectile Launcher accepts any projectile or weapons system that fits the IPS-N Universal Cartridge System. Most common is the conventional airburst shell – a fragmentation system designed to operate in all theaters, oxygenated or not – a ferocious weapon in the compact halls, safe rooms, and bolt chambers of capital ships and stations.

bondPowers.name: I'll Do It Myself
bondPowers.description: When an ally fails a skill check, you may attempt that check yourself using the same trigger. Your ally still takes any consequences from failing the check.

bondAnswers: A heart hardened by betrayal or great injustice.
minorIdeal: I humiliated or brought low a rival.

armor.flavorDescription: Kinetic shields are a common choice for personal defense among Karrakin nobles. Despite lacking features considered vital by most pilots, such as strength-augmentation, mech interface components, and protection against environmental hazards, shields have a few notable advantages over hardsuits. Most importantly, their generator packs are compact and easily concealed, enabling discreet use and providing protection with minimal impact on the user’s fashion choices.

weapons.flavorDescription: Medium A/C weapons are typically swords, officer’s sabers, and trench axes.
Heavy signature weapons are missile tubes, heavy lasers, light machine gun, or exotic rifles.

gear.flavorDescription: A powerful electronic scope that provides high-resolution magnification up to two miles, and automatically adjusts its reticle for wind, gravity, and pressure. Smart scopes can project their field of vision and all data to the HUD of any networked user. They can also pair with other thermal, optical, or simulated-vision devices to further enhance targeting.

Small, non-combat drones are a common sight in the field. They’re fairly noisy but can fly about half a mile with good maneuverability before losing signal, relaying audio and visual information as they go.
“Patch” is pilot slang for any kind of modern first aid gear, including sprayable medi-gel and instant-acting medical patches.
